lead_paragraph: The Mets avoided arbitration with their best defensive outfielder Tuesday by signing Endy Chávez to a two-year, $3.85 million contract. Chavez, 29, will make $1.8 million this season and $2.05 million in 2009. Chávez, who was limited to 71 games last season because of a left hamstring strain that knocked him out for nearly three months, batted .287 and scored 20 runs while playing his customary strong defense.
